alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henry and southeastern Franklin counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snow Creek, or near Sydnorsville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sydnorsville... Snow Creek... Sontag... and Mountain Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
